stories: Once upon a time, there was a man who sold beef.
One day, he discovered the goldmine called Bitcoin.
He then built the largest Bitcoin mining farm in Inner Mongolia, China.
Unfortunately, a government ban forced the farm to shut down.
He drove across China preaching Bitcoin, a trip nicknamed "Bitcoin China Tour."
He would say, "People born in the 60s and 70s bought homes for ¥3,000 per square meter and sold them to us for ¥30,000. One day I'll sell you today's ¥3,000 Bitcoin for $100,000!"
He added, "Bitcoin will definitely hit $1,000,000 someday. If not, I'll eat shit in front of you!"
He insisted, "Make sure your children each own one Bitcoin."

manorIntro.title: Scallion Manor Overview
manorIntro.usageContent:
# Scallion Manor Product Guide

## 1. Overview

Scallion Manor is a blockchain-powered digital asset inheritance platform designed for long-term holders. It offers secure storage for digital wealth and intelligent family inheritance workflows.

## 2. Core Features

### 2.1 Forced Saving Mechanism
Set custom lock periods to build long-term investing discipline and avoid emotion-driven trades during short-term volatility.

### 2.2 Inheritance Protection
Define trusted inheritors and handover rules so assets are transferred safely even in unexpected events.

### 2.3 Multi-Heir Management
Support multiple inheritors with flexible prioritization to keep family distribution orderly and controllable.

### 2.4 Decentralized Architecture
Smart contracts remove third-party custodians, ensuring transparency and security.

## 3. Ideal Use Cases

### 3.1 Long-Term Investment Planning
Great for investors who want enforced holding periods to curb over-trading and protect returns.

### 3.2 Family Wealth Succession
Provides a dedicated solution for households planning digital asset inheritance.

### 3.3 Retirement Planning
Acts as a long-term savings vault that strengthens retirement security.

### 3.4 Portfolio Optimization
Adds diversification and long-term value preservation to an investment mix.

## 4. Pricing

**Manor Access**: 1 WLD (one-time purchase, lifetime rights)

**Emergency Update Service**: 2 WLD (fast-track inheritor changes in urgent situations)
manorIntro.contractContent:
# Scallion Manor Terms & Operating Rules

## 1. Eligibility & Rights

### 1.1 Access
Pay 1 WLD to unlock lifetime manor access.

### 1.2 Non-transferable
Access is personal and cannot be transferred or shared.

## 2. Deposits & Locking

### 2.1 First Deposit
- You must set a lock period with your first WBTC deposit
- Funds cannot be withdrawn or moved during the lock
- The lock duration cannot be edited later

### 2.2 Additional Deposits
- Later deposits inherit the original expiry
- All funds share the same locking schedule

### 2.3 Cycle Management
- Withdraw everything once the lock expires
- Set a new period for the next cycle

## 3. Inheritor Management

### 3.1 Limits
- Up to 10 inheritors
- Inheritors must have a valid Scallion Manor account
- List order defines priority

### 3.2 Changes
- Standard updates require a 30-day cooldown
- Pay 2 WLD to execute an emergency update

## 4. Activity Monitoring

### 4.1 Actions That Refresh Activity
- Depositing funds (including zero-amount heartbeats)
- Editing inheritors
- Any operation that changes manor state

### 4.2 Rules
- Only the owner can refresh their own activity
- No one else can act on your behalf
- Inactivity over 365 days flags the manor as dormant

## 5. Withdrawal Rules

### 5.1 Preconditions
Funds must reach the locked expiry before withdrawal.

### 5.2 Priority Order

**Level 1**: Active owner can withdraw everything.

**Level 2**: If the owner is inactive, the first active inheritor may withdraw all assets.

**Level 3**: If owner and inheritors are inactive, the fallback address (e.g., charity) may withdraw.

**Level 4**: If nobody is active, funds remain locked until someone re-engages.

### 5.3 Method
Withdrawals are always full-balance; partial withdrawals are not supported.

## 6. Special Rights During Succession

### 6.1 Scope
When an inheritor gains withdrawal rights because the owner is inactive, they receive limited management powers.

### 6.2 Details
- They may add or remove inheritors ranked after themselves
- They cannot edit themselves or higher-priority entries
- The 30-day cooldown still applies
- Emergency edits remain available for a fee
